Dear DOMONIQUE DESHAUN COBB:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. No
substantial violations were found.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at 734-395-0920.
Sincerely,
Christopher M Barr, Licensing Consultant

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
License #: CI820201513
Licensee Group Organization: Wolverine Human Services
Licensee Designee: Judith Wollack
Chief Administrator: DOMONIQUE DESHAUN COBB
Agency Name: WOLVERINE CENTER
Agency Address: 2629 LENOX ST
DETROIT, MI 48215-2667
License Status: Regular
License Expiration Date: 07/31/2023
Capacity: 20
II. METHODOLOGY
Contact Date Contact With: Contact Contact
Method Purpose
03/07/2023 Staff Person 1 and Face to Face Unannounced
Youth’s A and B Visit
interviewed
03/09/2023 Staff Person 2 Face to Face Announced
interviewed. Visit
03/29/2023 Chief Administrator Telephone Pre-Exit
III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
1

Allegation Staff pulled youth hair and pushed him and put her arm around his
neck.
Investigation I reviewed intake dated 03/06/2023. It states that on 03/05/2023
Youth A was being extremely aggressive with escalated
behaviors. Youth A stated that Staff Person 1 pulled his hair,
yanked, and then pushed him. Youth A pushed Staff Person 1
back and told her not to touch him. Staff Person 1 then allegedly
put her right arm around Youth A’s neck like she was going to
choke him. Youth A does not any injuries and does not report any
pain, discomfort, or headaches. Youth A does not feel safe
around Staff Person 1.
Documentation reviewed:
I reviewed incident report dated 03/05/2023 at 11:15pm. It reports
Staff Person 1 extending her arm across the doorframe to prevent
any residents from leaving the short hallway due to safety of
another resident. Youth A continued to attempt to push through
Staff Person 1 at which point she placed both her arms on Youth
A’s arms to prevent him from assaulting her and redirected him
back to the short hallway. Chief Administrator/Complainant does
not report any additional allegations.
I reviewed incident report dated 03/05/2023 at 11:30pm. It reports
Youth A being overly aggressive upon return from AWOL and
coming in and out of his bedroom. Youth A broke the broom and
dustpan while being verbally aggressive toward staff. Youth A
engaging with another resident causing disruption on the floor and
later Youth A approaching staff, cursing, yelling, and screaming,
throwing objects, and threatening staff.
I reviewed incident report dated 03/05/2023 at 12:00am. It reports
Youth A going into another resident’s bedroom and taking
belongings and being instructed to return the items. Youth A was
cursing at staff and threw a ball which was retrieved by Staff
Person 1. Youth A then began pushing Staff Person 1 as she was
in a defensive stance to prevent from being assaulted when Staff
Person 2 stepped in between, and Staff Person 1 removed herself
from the area and called for assistance. Youth A then punching
the walls and doors.
Interviews:
I interviewed Youth A onsite with DHHS Worker 1, and the case
manager for Youth A, DHHS Worker 2 on 03/07/2023. He reports
being mad, though calm, at staff during shift change. He reports
2

wanting to throw something out and that Staff Person 1 prevented
him from walking through the hallway door by extending her arm
across it. Staff Person 1 instructed him to go back to his bedroom
and Youth A reports he went back. Youth A reports going into his
next-door neighbor’s bedroom and taking a room deodorizer and
then going into another resident’s bedroom. He then states going
into his own bedroom and that he came out and dropped a ball.
He reports Staff Person 1 picked the ball up and that he then
attempted to grab her “stuff”. He reports walking toward Staff
Person 1 who then extended her arm outward, grabbing his hair
and pulling it back, and then pushing him with the outside of her
forearm. Youth A then states that he pushed Staff Person 1 and
that she put her arm around his neck and that he broke free and
walked into his bedroom. Youth A indicates that Youth B and
possibly Staff Person 2 saw the incident. It is noted that Youth A
left the interview room only to come back minutes later to inform
this writer after the incident that he discovered Staff Person 1’s
fingernail in his hair after the incident.
I interviewed Youth B onsite with DHHS Worker on 03/07/2023.
Youth B reports being friends with Youth A from the community
and before placement. Youth B spoke fragmentedly and did not
report his alleged observations in a sequential timeframe. He
reports Staff Person 1 grabbing Youth A’s hair from the front and
pulling it backwards and then pushing Youth A with the side of her
arm. He reports Staff Person 1 had Youth A’s ball and that he
took it from Youth A’s hands. He states Staff Person 1’s
belongings were in the long hallway and that he was walking in
front of Staff Person 2 from the long hallway onto the short
hallway. Youth B states that Staff Person 2 informed him that she
didn’t see what had occurred.
I interviewed Staff Person 1 onsite with DHHS Worker on
03/07/2023. She reports being employed by the facility since
01/23/2023 and being trained in Therapeutic Crisis Intervention
(TCI). She reports at approximately 11:15pm that two staff were
present and eight residents, with four residents in the long hallway
and four in the short hallway. She reports another resident having
some issues in the long hallway and that she stood next to the
doorway extending her arm across the door opening preventing
Youth A’s access into the long hallway as he wanted to see what
was going on. She reports Youth A pushed her arm and that
another resident from the short hallway pulled Youth A back and
walked him into his bedroom. Later at approximately 12:00am,
Staff Person 1 was in the short hallway and observed Youth A
coming out of another resident’s bedroom with some of their
3

belongings. She reports Youth A throwing his ball at her and
when she bent over to pick it up, Youth A walked fast up on her
while swearing at her. Staff Person 1 reports placing herself in a
protective stance when Youth A started to push her toward a wall.
Staff Person 1 states Staff Person 2 stepped in between her and
Youth A and that she proceeded to move away from Youth A and
walk into the long hallway. Staff Person 1 states she was in a
defensive stance as taught in TCI when Youth A walked up on her
and began to push her. She denies grabbing Youth A’s hair and
denies placing her arm around his neck as alleged. She reports
Staff Person 2 was present and assisted in getting her away from
Youth A and notes that Youth B was also present. Staff Person 1
states disappointment that the facility security cameras are not
operational noting that such evidence would show that she did not
grab Youth A’s hair, push, or choke him as he alleges.
I interviewed Staff Person 2 onsite with DHHS Worker on
03/09/2023. She reports being employed by the facility since
01/30/2023 and being trained in TCI. She reports being
positioned in the short hallway at approximately 11:00pm noting
that Youth A had just come back to the facility from being AWOL.
Another resident was having an issue in the long hallway, so Staff
Person 1 stood in the doorway with her arm extended across it to
prevent any other residents from entering the area. She reports
Youth A was attempting to get through the sectioned off door and
that he pushed Staff Person 1 and then her. She then reports
Youth A going into another resident’s bedroom and began
harassing him, noting that Staff Person 1 directed Youth A out of
the bedroom. Youth A began throwing and bouncing a ball
throughout the hallway and that Staff Person 1 took the ball. She
then reports Youth A began pushing Staff Person 1 who had her
arms up in a protective stance and called for assistance. She
reports Staff Person 1 was stumbling backwards as Youth A
continued to push her and that Staff Person 2 stepped in between
the two to give Staff Person 1 some space to walk away from the
wall Youth A had her pinned to. Staff Person 2 states Staff
Person 1 was in a protective stance as she was being pushed
backwards by Youth A and did not report Youth A’s hair being
pulled or him being placed in a headlock as alleged. After Staff
Person 1 removed herself from the small hallway, Youth A then
went inside his bedroom.
DHHS Worker reports no findings.
Analysis There is no conclusive evidence to indicate that Staff Person 1
pulled Youth A’s hair, pushed him, and choked him as alleged.
4

Youth A returned from being AWOL agitated, was taking things
from other resident’s bedrooms, and instigating other residents,
while speaking aggressively with staff. Youth A began pushing
Staff Person 1 and she placed herself in a defensive stance as
taught in the facility’s behavior management system, Therapeutic
Crisis Intervention. Staff Person 2 was present and placed herself
in between Youth A and Staff Person 1 and did not report Youth
A’s hair being pulled or him being placed in a headlock as alleged.
Youth B reports Staff Person 2 was walking behind her and that
she informed him that she did not observe anything, which is false
as Staff Person 2 was present and intervened.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
03/29/2023
